summary: Mexico's flag is a vertical tricolor of green, white, and red with the country's coat of arms in the center of the white stripe. These colors were chosen after Mexico's independence from Spain. The red, white, and green also represent the Mexican national army. The coat of arms shows an eagle on a cactus, eating a snake, which is a legend from the Aztec Empire, symbolizing the founding of Mexico City.
title: Flag of Mexico
